channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023071156
item.description:
Report X-2023071156

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer 568921 from the unload already wet leaking and damaged. Package was placed in a lined red tote and taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Foam Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .20 gallons to release. Corrugated liner was on the top of the bottles and a liner was separating the bottles inside box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Foam Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner had a loose cap allowing .20 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the damaged leaking package, taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023071125
item.description:
Report X-2023071125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The drum fell off the rollers in unload and spilled. The area was cleared while cleanup was in progress. After absorbing as much as possible with pads, a fan was placed blowing on it toward the bay door until the remainder dried. DescribePack: The drum landed on its lid after falling. This bent the lid and allowed it to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The area was cleared while cleanup was in progress. After absorbing as much as possible with pads, a fan was placed blowing on it toward the bay door until the remainder dried.

item.title: Report X-2023071118
item.description:
Report X-2023071118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-15
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon opening the trailer it was discovered that packages had fallen into the hazmat, breaking one of the bottles. The package was placed in a lined hazmat bin and taken to QA to be processed as a damage. DescribePack: The top of one of the glass bottles had broken off and the hazmat had fallen over. spilling out virtually all of its contents. By the time the hazmat reached our facility, the contents had evaporated. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was removed and the trailer was aired out until it was safe to enter.

item.title: Report E-2023070809
item.description:
Report E-2023070809

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 11, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the dock floor due to a loose cap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ES personnel tightened the cap on the 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide. Crews utilized absorbents and a neutralizing agent to clean the top of the 55-gallon drum of potassium hydroxide. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023070373
item.description:
Report X-2023070373

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 042 advised of a spill on trailer#554775. 042 advised that it was a 5Gal pail with a pin hole in the bottom of it that was leaking UN1760, ~CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S.(SODIUM HYDROXIDE), 8, PG II, and that they took the pail turned it up side down and placed the pail in a ~recovery drum. 042 advised t hat there may have been approximately 1Gal that had leaked out of the pail. 042 also stated that the trailer ~floor and surrounding freight was dry and looked as if nothing spilled in the trailer. CURA was notified of the spill and advised that it ~would be okay to put the pail in the recovery drum, label it with corrosive label and the PRO# and the Waste Team would take care of it ~on their next visit to 042.

item.title: Report X-2023070917
item.description:
Report X-2023070917

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer #952851 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of decalcifier 1 one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release package did have slotted partitions but no bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023070914
item.description:
Report X-2023070914

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer # 806531 already wet leaking and damaged. Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package taken to hazmat cage. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was an inner box that had 2 x 1 liter plastic bottles of Rapicide PA part A, the 1 bottle was leaking from the cap allowing .20 liters to release. There was a corrugated liner to separate the other 2 x 1 liter's plastic bottles of Rapicide Pa part B inside the box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 liter plastic bottle of Rapicide PA part A was leaking from the cap allowing .20 liters to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package, then taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023070897
item.description:
Report X-2023070897

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a black bin on the J-Loop of Bank 1. Grabbed my PPE and put them on to bring back the damaged hazmat to QA. DescribePack: There is a big wet spot between one of the flaps of the box and the side of the box on one corner. I see one of the caps was not completely secured on the bottle. Pull both bottles out of the box to compare the liquid level of each one. The bottle with the loose cap liquid level were slightly lower than the other bottle. DurationRel: 22 and MitigateEffect: brought back to QA, replaced the bin with the red hazardous material bin and kept the box upright to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023070870
item.description:
Report E-2023070870

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: BANGOR
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer location for a waste pickup. Upon opening the trailer door the driver discovered that the trailer floor was wet and smelled strong odor. Driver immediately called dispatch and placed spill pads and speedy dry to contain the liquid to the trailer. Management called for emergency response to respond. Response time was 2-3 hours. Driver stayed with the vehicle until the response crew arrived and material was transferred into another 5 gallon drum. Original drum was placed in an overpack along with any cleanup materials that were used. Cause of the failure was determined to be missing gasket and ring for drum was put on upside down. In addition to the missing gasket there was a pinhole discovered in the side of the drum where the drum had been picked for loading.

  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. FOUND PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON SIDE AND BOTTOM OF THE BOX. NO LIQUID ON FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023061396
item.description:
Report X-2023061396

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEACKING PACKAGE, ARRIVED AT THE PACKAGE WITH PROPPER PPE ON AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. WHILE OBSERVING THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE THAT WAS DAMAGED HAD A DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE FOR PROPPER CLEAN UP OF PACKAGE THEN TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGES TO THE D.M.P FOR FURTHIR PROCESSING.

RESPONDER DECLARED THE SPILL TO BE HAZARDS AND FOLLOWED PROPER CLEAN UP OF PACKAGE. WHEN CLEAN UP WAS FINISHED, RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE D.M.P FOR FURTHER PROSSESING.

item.title: Report X-2023061748
item.description:
Report X-2023061748

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: Linwood
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 25th, a package was discovered leaking on the belt. The package contained UN3077 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, solid, n.o.s.(), 9, PGIII. It is unknown what caused the package to split and spill the contents it is possible that the package was overfilled. DG Admin advised to put the shipment into a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shipper declaration.
